head.title: World Briefing | Africa: Kenya: Global-Warming Pact On Its Way To Annan

hedline.hl1: World Briefing | Africa: Kenya: Global-Warming Pact On Its Way To Annan

abstract.p: Final step to enactment of Kyoto Protocol takes place in Nairobi, Kenya; Russian officials will present ratification papers to United Nations Sec Gen Kofi Annan; only four developed countries, United States, Australia, Liechtenstein and Monaco, have not signed treaty, which restricts greenhouse gases linked to global warming (S)

block.p: United Nations officials said that the final step leading to the enactment of the Kyoto Protocol, the first treaty restricting heat-trapping pollution linked to global warming, would take place today in Nairobi, the capital, where Russian officials are to deliver ratification papers signed by President Vladimir V. Putin to Secretary General Kofi Annan. The handoff will take place at a special two-day meeting there of the Security Council on the conflicts in Sudan. After President Bush rejected the climate treaty in 2001, the only way for it to gain sufficient support to take force was with Russian participation. Only four developed states have not ratified it: the United States, Australia, Liechtenstein and Monaco.

United Nations officials said that the final step leading to the enactment of the Kyoto Protocol, the first treaty restricting heat-trapping pollution linked to global warming, would take place today in Nairobi, the capital, where Russian officials are to deliver ratification papers signed by President Vladimir V. After President Bush rejected the climate treaty in 2001, the only way for it to gain sufficient support to take force was with Russian participation. Only four developed states have not ratified it: the United States, Australia, Liechtenstein and Monaco.
